website_summaries.verdict: Sony's HT-CT150 sound bar home theater system sounds great and is way ahead of the competition with its three HDMI inputs; however, its IR receiver limits the subwoofer's placement options.
pros: excellent sound quality for a sound bar home theater system
capable of switching between six devices
cons: IR receiver on the subwoofer limits its placement options

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant design, works better and quality is better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Alphsonik table is great. I only give it 4 stars as I hate the how the table announces when it connects or disconnects and is powered on and off. The wireless charger surface area could be a little bigger but I assume that would drive the price up. Speakers sound is amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Good Sound Bar and Sub
customer_reviews.text: I'd probably feel more comfortable rating this at a 3.5, but I'm giving it the benefit of the doubt. On the "Pros" side, it's sleak, provides more than adequate volume for a bedroom, and is pretty straight-forward to set up. On the "Cons" side, either the subwoofer or the settings are too limited to allow the system to produce the type of base that I expected from such a massive enclosure. Furthermore, the proprietary connector/wiring (in typical Sony fashion) is far too short to place the bar at one end of the room and the subwoofer at another. All-in-all, I'm satisfied with the setup for the price I paid. I'd recommend it, but not enthusiastically.
customer_reviews.author: Cocoabro

customer_reviews.title: Not expecting true surround, but much better than tv sound!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this about 6 months ago. It has exceeded my expectations. Just the fact that the quality of the sound itself was so much better than the tv sound had me hooked. There is a certain surround sound feel to it too that I don't get from tv which is awesome. If you have a smaller room (apt.) or on a small budget I would highly recommend. You will be surprised how much better movie watching can be. The optical hook-up works great too on those movies that play DTS sound, which is an added bonus, along with the fact that you can easily switch sound to dvd player or media player by simply using the remote. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: R. Crowley

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great with deep low end and crisp highs. However, not the best virtual surround sound.
customer_reviews.text: Connected via HDMI to Samsung Smart TV and sounds great with movies and netflix! Also connected to the old xbox 360 via optical cable and sounds amazing when playing Call of Duty and Grand Theft Auto V. Really fills my small living room with brilliant sound and deep low end. The sub alone is definitely worth the price. Surround sound isn't completely there but even the best virtual surround sound bars don't really compare to a true 5.1 speaker setup. So you get what you pay for. Regardless, it sounds amazing and it's extremely easy to install with it's simple design. No issues or complaints here.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew& Jesikah

customer_reviews.title: Mid tones and voice are not quality.its going back.
customer_reviews.text: Mid tones and voice are not quality. 5 presets to choose from but the tone is still not great. Also will not 'Pair with the TV speakers' if I wished to use them in tandem. Also sound level is very low. I was very supprised as this is Advertised as a 75watt unit. End of story is my Boston Acoustic 3.1 computer sound is by far much better at 25watts! If my Boston acoustic accepted Optical input I would be using this at 1/2 the cost. on the plus it will extend my HDMI ports. but its going back.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Sound is great on this, love the receiver, and there are plenty of ports to support optical audio, multiple HDMI ports, and more. Very sleek and modern look to it as well. I used to have a 5 speaker surround system, but got tired of having to run wires and have so many different components everytime I needed to move. This simplifies things quite a bit. The sound is not quite as 'surround' as I'd like, but it'll do. One thing I did wish it had was an option to have 3.5mm output, so I could plug in a pair of studio headphones to use in case I wanted to keep things quiet for others in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product
customer_reviews.text: My son really loves it and uses it all the time. nice design and good functionality. It fell on the side one time and broke around the edges. I cannot complain
customer_reviews.author: sahar

customer_reviews.title: We needed help setting it up.
customer_reviews.text: You will need some basic knowledge of electronics to set this up. My husband and I had some help with the initial set up. The first time we listened to the sound we thought the base was too heavy; now we are use to it and like it. This is not surround sound. However it is a huge improvement over the TV speakers. We still have not been able to switch over to one control to change channels and to monitor the volume and mute. This is not a huge problem for us and would not deter us from purchasing this unit. Someone who has more electronic savvy than us would not have any issues.
customer_reviews.author: D. R.

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, not great.
customer_reviews.text: The receiver is in the subwoofer, which is hard wired so it must be ace next to tv so as it can be turned off and on with the remote. Works with my harmony universal, just need to make sure I am pointing the remote in the right direction to hit the unit on the floor. Sound quality is okay. It's not surround sound and it doesn't boom base via music well, but does the job for watching tv in general area. I use Bose system for my big "game day" TV in another room when I want robust high quality sound. For the price, good unit.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Why Get A 5.1 Surround System??
customer_reviews.text: I was at first hesitant to purchase a sound bar, but I realized that with my small room size, a sound bar would be the perfect fit. The Sony HT-CT150 3D Sound Bar System provides a clear, crisp high quality surround sound that you will sure to enjoy. My main usage is playing Blu-Rays and my SACD's as well as sporting events. The 5.1 SACD's have a beautiful separation which makes listening to them a brand new experience. Easy to adjust and change the tone and levels to your desire. The subwoofer has a powerful bass that will surprise you. If you have any Sony products, the remotes are compatible. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Steven67

customer_reviews.title: Decent sound but hard to balance well
customer_reviews.text: I got this to really pump music in my small apartment but still be portable for my frequent moving. Pros: 1. Easy hookup 2. Decent sound 3. Not bad volume depending on audio source. Don't expect to blast a theater but a small apartment can really make your ears hurt. 4. Decent range for a sound bar Cons: 1. Too expensive for performance 2. Voices are very unbalanced in some movies and games. This results in some nerve wracking tweaking of the settings to avoid barely hearing dialogue then getting blasted out of your seat for action scenes.
customer_reviews.author: Scott H.

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: This product must be looked at in context for what it is - a simple speaker bar system. The sound quality is quite good with that in mind - no it's not a Bose level system, but I wasn't looking to spend that amount of money. It is easy to switch between TV, DVD, ROKU, etc. There are different settings to adjust for movies, sports, music which is nice. We purchased a Sony DVD player along with this just to simplify the number of remotes we have, and they work seamlessly. Good value, decent sound, I definitely recommend this system.
customer_reviews.author: T. J.

customer_reviews.title: Can hear the actual words now!
customer_reviews.text: This is not a speaker...I was expecting a booming surround sound speaker type sound but what I got was a "CRISP SOUND" which is better becuase I dont have to be worried about it being too loud. I now can watch movies and hear every word, we were watching Finding Nemo and we could hear the swishing of the shark swimming in the water...it's cool. I am satisfied with my purchase but I do kinda wish it would create more of a surrounding sound. If your looking for a surround sound you should get the 5.1 systems that cost much more or buy additional speakers to hook up to this one.
customer_reviews.author: SNJ

customer_reviews.title: Sound out?
customer_reviews.text: After a little over a month of use I'd have to say I'm pretty happy with the sound from this unit. I actually made a mistake when ordering and thought this was the version with the wireless sub. It is not but didn't want to mess with returning so kept it. If your looking to this to substitute your TV then it's perfect if your looking for a surround sound then it's not. I thought after reading some reviews here it would be a little more of a surround unit but it's not really, that's ok. Really when the sound and sub kick in it's pretty awesome and like my wife said "it's like the theater!"
customer_reviews.author: N. Black

customer_reviews.title: No headphone Jack!
customer_reviews.text: No headphone jack! BAD I have limited hearing and headphones are very important for the rest of my household. To me not to have a headphone jack is just unthinkable and that is why I missed the fact that it doesn't have one, thought all things of this nature has a headphone jack. For people who can hear it's ok speaker system if you just need a little push for your TV this will do just fine. I also got the universal bar speaker hanger and the speaker is connected to the back of my TV and sits just above the top of my TV. Nice.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Sony CT150 / Vizio Smart 50 tv
customer_reviews.text: The Sony sound bar CT150 was a great addition to the Vizio 50 inch Smart tv. The sound bar was bought because of several reviews that said sound was not good from the tv. The sound was fine and I went ahead and ordered the sound bar.. I am glad I did. The sound from the tv was good but the sound with the sound bar was exceptional. Have listened to a movie and ballgame but we are using sound bar for regular tv. The sound is more pure. The extra cost was worth it and the Vizio tv has super picture and actually both were on sale. Two great purchases as of today.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Big sound for a little speaker
customer_reviews.text: I bought this sound bar for my apartment because I wanted a great sound without having to sell my kidney for them. I also hate having cables/wires running everywhere so I love that the sound bar is wireless. Although I would have loved it more if the subwoofer is wireless but I have it near my TV so that wasn't much of an issue. I watched War Horse last night and had to turn down the sound a couple times because I could feel my wood floor vibrating. It is a great value and great sound. Please don't compare this to a $500+ 5.1 sound system, must be realistic.
customer_reviews.author: Catheriya

customer_reviews.title: Not Wireless
customer_reviews.text: Shown on some websites as wireless. Wireless means does not come with digital optical cable or HDMI cables. The sub woofer will have five cables/cords coming out and the bar will have a single speaker cord. Warning in manual: "Do not trip over cables". Reallly! Quality of sound is excellent and that is the main reason to purchase. Price from Dr. Rays was great $175 although they had an ordering glitch and it arrived one week later than the original estimate.
customer_reviews.author: Buzz

customer_reviews.title: Very nice system for the bedroom.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set because I didn't want to run surround sound wires. I'm not going to tell you it sounds as good as my Sony surround sound set but it does a great job. The sound bar fits underneath my TV on top of the dresser and the bass controller on the floor beside it. I like the set up options and it has excellent bass and treble control. The whole thing was easy to hook up. This unit has more than enough bass for a bedroom in fact I have had to reduce it from my original settings. I feel this was a excellent buy for my bedroom flat screen.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Good System!
customer_reviews.text: This system is perfect for people who need a simple system that is easy to operate. the biggest plus - easy to hook-up and operate (especially with other Sony components), biggest minus - not enough volume - this unit is made for smaller spaces, I bought it for my parents who need a simple system where vocals and voice tracks can be emphasized, this system works good for that but in their living room it doesn't really get the volume necessary to "fill the room". This system would be perfect for an average sized bedroom (no more than 14'x14').
customer_reviews.author: DrJoel14

customer_reviews.title: Nice system, very crisp audio, descent bass
customer_reviews.text: This is not a "blow you out of your couch" type of surround sound system, but if you are looking for a nice neat system that does not require speaker wire and speakers all over the living room and provides nice full sound, then this is the system for you. I like that it has so many HDMI inputs, I may use that in the future. In my current setup, I am just using the Toslink input which is hooked straight to my TV so whatever is on TV is playing on this automatically. I like the sound, my wife loves that it is much more inconspicuous than previous systems that we have had. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: AARON K YODER

customer_reviews.title: Amplifiers be damned ... Brilliant piece of kit
customer_reviews.text: Forget amplifiers and wires and connections. This Sound Bar and Sub-woofer is a brilliant piece of engineering. Read a CNET review and OMG it has three HDMI connections plus cable/sat hdmi in. Simple, fast installation. Then it has great sound to boot. Highly recommended. Do remember that all connections go into the sub-woofer and the sub-woofer must be visible to the remote when using the remote. Excellent. Great price from Amazon too. Woohoo!.
customer_reviews.author: R. Crook

customer_reviews.title: Nice sound
customer_reviews.text: Finally a sound bar that lets me adjust the center speaker so that I can hear the dialog. It really improves the sound, especially with movies. I previously tried the JVC BC1 which had great sound but the dialog was lost, the Vizio had the same issue. The downside of the Sony is the multi button remote. I don't need to turn on my coffee pot, just adjust the sound. Having the remote work through the sub woofer isn't an issue. It is very sensitive and can therefore be changed from anywhere in the room. The others were shipped back but the Sony has found a home.
customer_reviews.author: lunker

customer_reviews.title: Great amplified sound with THREE HDMI inputs!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second ct150 I bought because the first one zapped out with a rare lightening strike. I bought another! So that should tell you something. Great amplified sound and unit has three HDMI inputs on the back panel where many only have two! As for the sound quality, this sound bar has plenty of power without distortion. Sure, you could spend more but this is FAKE 3D, right?! The price for what you get here is excellent, IMO. When I'm ready to spend more, I'll go real 3D!
customer_reviews.author: P. Falsetti

customer_reviews.title: Good Little unit.
customer_reviews.text: This it a good little sound bar setup. I works great as our small bedroom sound system for the tv media player in there. Has plenty of HDMI hook up's and a couple rca type. Sounds good for it's basic setup. Made some small brackets out of metal strap material you get in a roll at your local hardware store 1/2" wide and mounted the soundbar floating below the TV. Sony has a bracket to fit their TV's but for others you have to be creative as I did or set it on the shelf in front of your TV. Nice basic setting built in to adjust like having a surround receiver. Speaker levels to Bass and treble.
customer_reviews.author: C. Young

customer_reviews.title: Great for anyone not wanting a full movie theater system
customer_reviews.text: Much better sound than I expected. The subwoofer provides good bass. The digital input worked perfectly the first time. Several different modes to choose from such as Movie, Game, Sports. Only gripes are related to the remote and menu. The menu can be tricky at first, or if you haven't used it in awhile and forget how it works. A cat stepped on the remote one day pressing some buttons. It took me five minutes to figure out what to do to get the sound working again. And if the remote will control other Sony devices, why not include the PS3?
customer_reviews.author: J. MILES

customer_reviews.title: After nearly a year as a member of the family..
customer_reviews.text: ..this unit has been amazing. We have a very small home with a small living room so the size and application of the system was an easy choice. Thanks to the great reviews last year we selected this Sony and have not looked back. This little guy sounds so good it inspired my father-in-law to run out and purchase one. Very rich sound, clean highs and more lows that we even use. Great sounding surround (simulated). Blows us out of the place. If there are any cons I have not found it in nearly a year. Purchase with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Crocker

customer_reviews.title: Good Sound
customer_reviews.text: I bought this sound bar for my sunroom. The sound bar delivers clear sound and tight bass.I haven't used it with a blu-ray player but with Netflix and over the air HD TV I can't hear any rear sound effects but I am very happy with the sound.For me it is hard to locate the subwoofer.Great job on the crossover Sony.I have heard small 5.1 systems where the subwoofer doesn't blend in as well as this system.If I want to listen to 7.1 with room shaking bass I will go in my den but for Netflix and HD TV you can't beat this sound bar for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Sounds great
customer_reviews.text: My sister bought this product first, so we took her recommendation when we were looking for a system. It's small, but comes with a big sound. There are multiple menu options (although we tend to leave it on standard), which can add to the sound clarity. I watch TV while using the elliptical, so being able to turn the sound up and still hear everything over the sounds of the machine is great. The subwoofer doesn't take up much floor space. Purchase, plug in, and relax.
customer_reviews.author: RoseMary Griffith

customer_reviews.title: Great Alternative to the stock TV sound
customer_reviews.text: This small system is pretty impressive in a small bedroom environment. I was actually impressed with the overall sound quality. I probably could have settled with a bar only, no sub. That sub delivers a pretty solid punch and is, for me, a little over the top for bedroom viewing. My daughter is almost completely deaf however and she gives the system two thumbs up. So now this Sony system battles my ONKYO in the living room when I have my kids over on the weekends. ..... In a condo, no less!!! lol Neighbors love me I'm sure!!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Donawho

customer_reviews.title: This won't take the place of a dedicated home theater
customer_reviews.text: I wanted some better sound from my living room tv/blu-ray player and didn't want to run wires everywhere so this seemed to fill my needs. The price was right and there aren't a bunch of wires running everywhere but I don't really notice much of a 3d sound effect with any source. The switchable HDMI inputs are really nice (and will pass 3d) and they actually make my Logitech remotes work much better (most of my experience with these remotes involves the tv not switching sources properly because it takes too long to start and the input switching commands are sent almost immediately after the power on command is sent).
customer_reviews.author: M. ADAM C GOTT

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: You definitely have to read the instructions for proper setup, espcecially if you are not an audio-visual expert AND if you have numerous components. However, once setup was completed, I tested out the sound levels on different channels, i.e. sports, music, and local channels. I'm into bass, so the bass was appropriate for apartment living. It didn't shake the floor or anything, but it was adequate enough. If you are an audiophile, you may want something with more power and additional speakers. If you live in a one-bedroom apartment, like myself, it's definitely adequate.
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price and is exactly what the product claimed
customer_reviews.text: The center speaker in the 3-speaker bar makes all the difference, it makes the human voices much crisp and clear. We have a medium size great room, and this system is good enough to fill it up with quality sound. The sub-woofer generates good bass too. This makes up for the lack of good sound on flat screen TVs. Now we can actually hear the dialogues in the movies with the help of different modes (Movie, Drama, News, Game, Standrd, Music, etc). If you are expecting a home theater type experience, then you need to look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Easy Rider

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas present from my wife for my man cave. I have to admit, I was a little intimidatted when I read the instructions thinking I may be out of my league. I hate setting up remotes,DVD's, etc. and often call in help. Im not the most patient person either. Boy was I surprised. Had it hooked up in 15 minutes and completely set up in my entertainment center in 30minutes. Sound is very good for the price and would highly suggest to those wanting to complete their cave.
customer_reviews.author: j rocket

customer_reviews.title: Think of this as an improvement on your TV speakers
customer_reviews.text: Of course this isn't the best surround sound system in the world but its a HUGE step up from my TV speakers. It delivers quite a lot of bass, which is more than I actually need since i live in an apartment complex and can't have massive bass anyway. If you have a setup like me and your living room doesn't really allow you to have a 5.1 system set up without looking hideous and getting in the way, I highly recommend getting a sound bar. And for the price I think this was a good purchase for massive upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: DAVID VIPOND

customer_reviews.title: Nice Box. Won't Work Without Right HDMI
customer_reviews.text: I bought the box and it worked for a while then clipped off and on. Frustrating. After many calls and time spent, changed the cables from highly reviewed HDMI cables to Sony ([...]. Worked fine. I give it 3 stars because the proprietary, special cables this box needs to work should be included in the package; or a there should be a disclaimer stating that the Sony cables are a required option. The sound quality is OK for the price. I would not buy again. Instead, I'd pay the extra for cube system from Bose.
customer_reviews.author: Marky Mark

customer_reviews.title: Sony HTCT150 3D Sound Bar System
customer_reviews.text: Very good value with excellent sound. Hooked up quickly and with some time reading the manual, was enjoying great sound. Like that it has several sound setting to select from the remote... do not like the fact that you can barely read the diode menu on the front of the woofer. Also, wished that the woofer was wireless, but realize that the sound electronics are located in the woofer instead of the sound bar.
customer_reviews.author: Forecaster

customer_reviews.title: An outstanding item
customer_reviews.text: This sound bar greatly improves audibility of network TV dramas viewed on my LCD set (admittedly small at 32 inches). Before I bought it, much of the dialog was not comprehensible. I use primarily settings for drama and music. The music setting was particularly pleasing while viewing the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade. A very minor issue is the high directionality of the remote that is required to change settings - the subwoofer receives the output from the remote. But that is due to my tendency to move the TV set around so that I can watch it from the dining room table. I am very glad I bought this item.
customer_reviews.author: r

customer_reviews.title: It’s pretty good, too pricey
customer_reviews.text: Great sound! But not perfect. The price was too much. What made this sell is the brand
customer_reviews.author: Jesus G.

customer_reviews.title: ok for the money
customer_reviews.text: This sound bar is better than the tv speakers, will not fill a large room. You notice there is something missing in the audio between the center speakers and the bass. It doesn't really imitate surround sound. This is a stand alone system, you can't add surround speakers to it. Tried it on the tv in the main room, will move it to the bedroom. It is a good option if you have a very limited budget. It does have better connectivity than other systems for your blu-ray and other devices.
customer_reviews.author: Hgrubbs

customer_reviews.title: Very cool
customer_reviews.text: I freaking love this thing i want to just order 3 more and sync them see how cool that will sound....... Picks up low bass very well I can't even go up half was with out shaking the room....... Outside omg this thing is carries sound pretty far crisp clear I'm using mine with my Beats audio HTC ONE ........ I also got the blue tooth for the iPod dock not as loud as if u plug the auxiliary cable direct ....
customer_reviews.author: carlos

customer_reviews.title: Sony Bar Sound System
customer_reviews.text: We really enjoy the Sony Sound Bar System. It was easy to hook up to our Cable TV system with our Sony Bravia TV. The instructions were very clear and we had an extra HDMI cable so we did not have to purchase any other items. The base box that comes with the system enhances the whole sound experience and I would not buy a sound bar system without base. The system was easy to synchronize with our cable tv using one remote. Thanks to Sony by providing a nice system!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Hauser

customer_reviews.title: Sound Magic
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Sony product after an extensive research on the web. It has lived up to all that the ads said. The sound feels like surround sound even though it is only a sound bar. The quality and volume is more than my room can handle. I am more than pleased with the output. I did find it a little challenging when trying to incorporate the HDTV, HD cable box, Roku and Blu Ray disc player. I finally had to consult a professional. However, that is not Sony's fault. That is just the complexity of today's electronics. I am completely satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Smith

customer_reviews.title: Solid choice for a sound bar.
customer_reviews.text: I have a small apartment, and needed a sound bar system with decent bass as well as crisp treble. This is a system that delivers. Very easy to set up, even with the wired sub. My primary gripe is the fact that the remote included is overly complicated. This is because of the "Bravia Sync" feature, which allows you to control a Bravia TV through the sound system. Really not a useful feature unless you have a Bravia TV. Other than the above gripes, this system is quality. Definitely worth it if you don't mind the wired sub.
customer_reviews.author: BuffaloPhil

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, but did not last very long.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product about 2.5 years ago. Initially, I was very happy with it. It has 3 HDMI inputs, so I could hook up my blu-ray, Xbox, and DVR to the same system. The sound quality was good -- not as good as a full surround-sound system, of course, but still good. However, over the last year, I have noticed that it would frequently lose the HDMI signal, so that the screen would go black for about a second before it recovered. This has been happening with increased frequency lately, to the point where it is annoying. So although I started out loving the product, it did not last very long.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A Bliton

customer_reviews.title: I'm Convinced
customer_reviews.text: I had never seen a sound bar before, and I was skeptical. So much so, that first I bought a cheaper surround system. It was cheaper, and was horrible. So after the mistake of spending less for a standard surround system, I decided lets try the sound bar. (this is for my bedroom by the way, my living room has a full 5.1 surround system, 103" HD screen and a 300 watt sub...) I was able to quickly install it, it came with all the wires I needed for my TV and blu-ray player. It was 10 minutes from box to hearing it in action. I have not been disappointed. For a small room or bedroom this item is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan G. Fresh

customer_reviews.title: Great System
customer_reviews.text: I love this sound bar system. My old ears are getting a little hard of hearing and this system is perfect. I live in a town house and did not want to disturb my neighbor with pound sound so I thought I would try this sound bar system. I placed the sound bar system behind my lazy boy chair and ran an optical cable to the TV. This set up is perfect --- volume at normal levels with better sound than what the TV speakers provided.
customer_reviews.author: Kimo

customer_reviews.title: better than the TV speakers
customer_reviews.text: this is a pretty good system for the price. though it has sound quality issues with putting out good mid range sound. highs and bass are great, but mid range is low. so if you turn up the volume to hear the mids then when the highs and bass come in they are loud. I will do more tweaking to see if I can get this mitigated. I was impressed that my Panasonic Plasma TV recognized the Sony system and controls the volume of the sound bar system with the TV remote.
customer_reviews.author: Roger R. Paradis

customer_reviews.title: Great sound no Direct TV  codes  will  not work with Harmony remote
customer_reviews.text: First purchased Direct TV had no codes to support it. Still none I know of. Just bought Harmony 650 remote it will not work with it either after 1.5 hrs with customer suport at Harmony (they are great) then 1.5 hrs with Sony. They do not guarentee it every working with a universaL. i HAVE THE LG 3 D 6500 SMART TV AND dIRECT TV hr24 200. I connected hdmi cable fr sony ARC to HDMI 1 arc on LG and direct tv to LG tv. What a mess!
customer_reviews.author: sheperdess

customer_reviews.title: SONY sound bar HT/CT-150
customer_reviews.text: This system has a very good sound and lots of adjustments for sound output, but it is difficult to install and set up unless one is a sound technician. Took me hours to figure out the connections to the DirectV HD player, Toshiba HD TV, satellite connections, and then to program the remote. This system is designed for Sony Bravia applications and I would have avoided buying it if I knew how much effort was involved. You can get a plug and play Vizio at Walmart for a lesser price and equivalent sound.
customer_reviews.author: David Stockman

customer_reviews.title: Good sound! Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: This is the first soundbar I've owned, and I'm quite pleased with it. I have a 7.1 and 5.1 component systems and am pretty particular to sound. No this isn't going to compete with those systems, but I do have in it in a large open room (our rec room) and it provides more than adequate bass and sound volume for wii games and occasional music and TV. It will blow away TV speakers and it looks nice. The HDMI switching is good to have as well.
customer_reviews.author: newlinux

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace my broken 5.1 system, and I must say that I am very impressed with this set up. The subwoofer acts as a reciver with 3 hdmi inputs that allow you to hook up a blue ray player and hd satillite/cable box and a hd game system all at one time. The sound bar is not to tall and looks very nice on top of my tv cabinet. This system does a good job with movies and regualar tv. Not 5.1 but, unless you like having speakers behind you more than likely you will not be able to tell. I am extremly happy with my purchase, and highly recomend this sony sound system.
customer_reviews.author: C. Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect ...
customer_reviews.text: We are enjoying this product. It was easy to install -- the 3 HDMI inputs are a huge convenience. The remote makes it easy to switch between several different audio profiles. I was surprised at how often I switch between them to obtain the best sound for a particular TV program or DVD. I would have rated it 5 stars if the remote could be used to operate my non-Sony Bravia TV (that is the only one supported), and if the mid-range frequencies were a little stronger.
customer_reviews.author: Larry S

customer_reviews.title: Good looking and sounding
customer_reviews.text: So far I have enjoyed the unit. It definitely adds to the sound system to my 50" TV. Good sound quality and the looks is of the unit is great. My only two cons on the product is that it is a wired subwoofer, so it limits you to where you can put it, since all the connections go into the subwoofer. The second is that I wish the subwoofer had a little more bang to it. However all in all, a good quality Sony product.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey B.

customer_reviews.title: Best Soundbar for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of shopping around, looking for a sound bar around this price range to buy my parents as a gift. Based off the reviews, I bought the Sony. Installation was very straight forward, and the look of the system is very clean. They are not audiophiles by any means, but they are very happy with the sound. I'm sure you can spend 3 times the amount on a higher end sound bar, but for the price, you will be happy with this choice.
customer_reviews.author: Zubz

customer_reviews.title: Only does Bluetooth.
customer_reviews.text: This item has two usb inputs but it does not play a USB stick. Three options of charging
customer_reviews.author: BLR

customer_reviews.title: Average Sound..
customer_reviews.text: The sound from the speakers is better than those of TV speakers, but not so good overall. The mids sound a bit muffled. So the dialogue voices sound similar. I was mainly looking for good sound for dialogues, but couldn't find it here. The sub is so heavy that it cant be moved easily, also it is not wireless.(so limited in placement) .The bass from the sub does fall short in terms of the 'thump' The GUI for choosing options is pretty basic as well. Samsung HW E450C is comparatively better than this. I promptly returned the item in its original packaging to the last detail within a few days and Amazon was very helpful in accepting the item back.
customer_reviews.author: amar

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: I went back and forth on a bunch of different and newer sound bars - I even tried a Polk Audio and Samsung that cost more, in the end I went back to the Sony. For a sound-bar, the sound is great and the bass is deep. The fact that it has 4 HDMI inputs is another great feature, most sound bars only have optical. No it doesn't compare to a true surround setup but this is a sound-bar and for that it does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: N. J. Schreiber

customer_reviews.title: Solid Product
customer_reviews.text: I have the original CT100 and just purchased the cT150 for my bedroom and new Sony NX810. I am very impressed with the newer design and the glossy finish is top notch. The overall functionality and ease of use is the same as CT100 but the quality seems to be improved. The sub is heavier and the sound bar design has been improved. The "screen" is no longer a metal mesh but a cloth. I really enjoy the product and wouldn't hesitate to suggest it to someone else looking for a nice sound bar setup.
customer_reviews.author: lsevenl

customer_reviews.title: Sounds bigger than it is
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a Samsung WS1 home theater that malfunctioned. It's on par with top tier soundbar systems that are priced much higher. It has great connectivity and functionality and lots of customization features. I haven't turned it all the way up yet because I haven't seen a need to. My guess is it's louder than I'll ever need unless I decide to host a rave or something. It feels great having all that power on tap though just in case I ever felt like using it. Hopefully it lasts for a long time unlike the Samsung. Great Product so far!
customer_reviews.author: GTI

customer_reviews.title: Sound Bar System
customer_reviews.text: We got rid of our older Sony home theater system and opted for a sound-bar since the room with our TV is rather small. This provides great sound with far fewer speakers and wires. Really like the night-time sound feature which allows you to 'dim' the sound without losing clarity for those of us who watch late at nigth and don't want to disturb others in the house. This unit is very attractive and a great price for the quality of sound and ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: Debora L. Huthmacher

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful sounds
customer_reviews.text: I've had normal surround sound systems and this one is just as good and better in some ways. The sound quality is excellent, beautiful really.. The surround capabilities are really great, too. It throws the sound all around the room. The only thing I don't like about this system is that I can't get as much bass out of it (for music purposes) as I'd like, Plenty enough for movies and TV though. Get this if you want a fairly inexpensive, really great sounding system for movies and television.
customer_reviews.author: majindrizzt

customer_reviews.title: Skeptical amid poor reviews, but
customer_reviews.text: I was first skeptical after initial use because I didn't hear the earth shattering bass some talked about in reviews. Then... I read the booklet and figured out how to adjust the levels and it was incredible. The system works great for games and movies. It mimmicks 5.1 surround sound really well. I didn't want a lot of space taken up with a 5 speaker system. This is easy to use and works amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon R

customer_reviews.title: If only it was a cd player as well omg love it! I listen to dubstep-y music Electronica pop ...
customer_reviews.text: I originally got this for my boyfriend but as soon as I tried it out I had to get one for myself! If only it was a cd player as well omg love it! I listen to dubstep-y music Electronica pop rock and metal. Sounds perfect with all of it but stuff with a ton of bass does kinda lag out otherwise it does sound great.
customer_reviews.author: Jack3

customer_reviews.title: Sony HT-CT150 3D Sound Bar System
customer_reviews.text: I must say that I am really impressed with the quality of the sound, and its ability to fill the room like a surround sound system. It was so easy to set up, not a bunch of wires going every where, and really easy to integrate alot of other devices. I got a sony Blu-Ray player to go with it, and it integrated well. I still havent figured out the HDMI control for other devices, but its still really cool.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Foulon

customer_reviews.title: Big improvement in TV sound
customer_reviews.text: I got this sound bar to replace the sound from my 46" Samsung LCD TV. I now have much better sound quality without having to place a lot of speakers. My only suggestion would be that the sound bars seem to be better integrated with TV's of the same make. The only inconvenience with my setup is that I have to turn on the sound bar separately. Everything else can be done through the Directv remote.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis F

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my living room
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product so that I could have one sound system for multiple sources: HDTV, PC, DVD, etc. It was more compact than other systems I looked at (went to Best Buy to look a physical systems). The speaker bar is not as wide as some other systems, so it fits my 32" HDTV just fine. It's a good looking system - it looks like it fits. I don't need booming, room filling sound, so the sound from this system is more than adequate. I bought this product almost a year ago and have been very pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: E. Brewer

customer_reviews.title: Great soundbar
customer_reviews.text: Bought this soundbar to upgrade the sound on my new Toshiba LED TV. Hook up was simple and everything worked straight out of the box. If you're expecting surround sound quality from this soundbar, then look somewhere else. If you're looking for a cheap and easy way to expand your sound for your TV, then you can't go wrong w/ this item. I'm not an audiophile by a long shot, but this system does the job for me.
customer_reviews.author: Andrei

customer_reviews.title: Good sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Great value. The sound is great. I really like the different pre-set modes you can select, like SPORTS, DRAMA, MOVIES, NEWS etc. Sports sounds great for football games. you really hear the band and crowd separated out from the play by play. Base is really rich. For most viewing I can crank it loud enough but occasionally I would like to be able to go slightly louder than it's highest setting. The only other deficiency I see is that it is not always synced with the actors lips. It is only slightly off but it is noticeable.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Zeitler

customer_reviews.title: Very nice - recomended specially for Sony TV owners
customer_reviews.text: Pro: If you have a Sony Bravia like me, you will like system. It has ample HMDI outlet, solid construction and good audio volume and range for medium room Cons: Sync with Sony Bravia was not simple and not obvious, it took me almost 30 minutes to get this simple task done. Instruction for Sync needs improvement. For example, there was no onscreen hints when successful Sync with Bravia TV.
customer_reviews.author: Andy K.

customer_reviews.title: These speaker tables are the ultimate combination of form and function.
customer_reviews.text: These tables are beautiful and functional. They make the perfect accent table or night stand and the quality of the sound in the speaker is amazing. I love components that match form and function so beautifully. very good quality all around.
customer_reviews.author: Caryn M.

customer_reviews.title: Don't listen to the kiddies...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great compromise! I've owned a HT-CT100 for 2+ years and added this to a location in the house (bedroom) where 5.1 is not feasible. Don't use pass-thu, use the system, which works perfectly. You will love the extra attention you've given to those places that you've missed "proper" sound. Don't expect this to be a replacement for 5.1, as that's not what it's designed to be, it's simply to be used as an *fantastic* inexpensive HDMI switch w/ 3 inputs and you would like better than 2.0 sound. Don't buy it in stores, saved $30+ with shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Bob the Builder

customer_reviews.title: Good sound !
customer_reviews.text: Really good product, using it with my Sony Bravia TV. Bar is lightweight so I actually attached to to bottom of TV with black velcro strips. Subwoofer sounds great (which is what you're really missing with TV speakers). Went with this instead of wireless subwoofer because I like the concept of all component wires going down to subwoofer and only one wire going up to TV on wall from subwoofer.
customer_reviews.author: G. Creal

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Sound for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this sound bar. Having worked in retail audio for many years I haven't been a fan of Sound Bar/HTIB (Home Theater In a Box) type systems. I have always recommended component type systems. However, I recently moved into an apartment in the city where that just isn't an option anymore. This sound bar is surprisingly clear, the Night Mode feature is a great help to eliminate too much bass at night, and has 3 HDMI ports which is good for anyone with a couple Game Systems and a HDBox. I highly recommend for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Adam M Rojas

customer_reviews.title: Low Priced Sound Bar, Middle of the Road Sound
customer_reviews.text: Hey, if you don't want to break the bank on a sound bar and simply need just a bit better sound then your TV set, then this sound bar will work. Overall, I am not a huge fan of the interface connections that force all your hdmi cables to go thru subwoofer, into a single HDMI line out to TV, but it works. Adequate but not great. Definitely bare bones.
customer_reviews.author: Long Time on Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Sony Soundbar Delivers-mostly
customer_reviews.text: The Sony soundbar I bought really improves the quality of sound from my Panasonic plasma TV, and so far, I'm very happy with it. Here's a short list of improvements that would have earned the fifth star: 1. The difference between the Standard, News, and Sports sound fields is hard to tell. If there is true value in these types, then a more obvious difference in them is useful. 2. The LED readout on the sub-woofer is small, faint, and hard to see from as close as 5 feet. Either make this bigger and brighter, or create an option to adjust it. Other than those two points, I'm very satisfied with this product, and will recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Storey

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these for both my boys for X-Mas and it went over very well. The sound it awesome! The only thing that is on the down side is that you have to buy a separate Bluetooth module that cost $90. All in all it is fantastic. At the cost of $190 I will buy it again and again if I had the need.
customer_reviews.author: ILE Productions

customer_reviews.title: The bass is great. if You put it to the max you ...
customer_reviews.text: This speaker is incredible and worth every damn dollar. The bass is great. if You put it to the max you can hear it a block away :D my neighbors hate me :D it was definitely constructed for hip hop or house music. You hear and feel every note. You CANNOT go wrong for this price. I'm a house music fanatic and this speaker serves it's purpose
customer_reviews.author: SewingWildOats

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound! Works great on Apple Tv but does not work for Roku
customer_reviews.text: Netflix uses Dolby Digital Plus, which needs to be converted to Dolby Digital. To keep a low price, Roku didn't buy this from Dolby. Roku figures either your tv, or sound system will convert this for you (this sound bar doesn't). Apple TV does convert dd+ to dd SO if you have an apple TV i would definitely recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: daHeal

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic sound bar for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use in my bedroom since the speakers on LCD TVs are always terrible. I was pleasantly surprised at how well the sound is on this. It's very crisp, and the bass from the subwoofer is nice and deep. Granted, it's no Polk system or anything, but it's extremely good for the price. The only gripe I have is that there is no menu that pops up on the TV for volume and inputs, so make sure you have a good line of site to the LCD display on the subwoofer when altering settings.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great range of sound
customer_reviews.text: So far superior to any built in speakers. This really brings out true depth of sound. Pros * Easy to set up * Soundbar is small * Comes with optical audio cable * Can talk to other sony devices to reduce the number of remotes you need (HDMI cable on ARC port required) Cons * The tower is pretty large
customer_reviews.author: Brian Adriance

customer_reviews.title: sounds good..for some songs.
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so I know that the product is meant to be listened to by a certain type of person. One that likes hip hop and rap or Dubstep. For these genres, its great! quite a bit of other genres just wont sound that great though. The bass is DEFINITELY present.
customer_reviews.author: Freedomrings

customer_reviews.title: Everything looked great....
customer_reviews.text: Until I unpacked the box and the speaker wires were missing from the package. The subwoofer, remote, batteries, speaker and toslink cable were in the package. But NO SPEAKER WIRES! Which essentially renders this thing useless! On the phone with Sony now trying to get replacement wires. Since Amazon tells me that if a part is missing from the package I need to contact the manufacturer! I will let you know how the sound bar works once I can actually plug it in and use it! Way to go Amazon in shipping a product missing a key component!
customer_reviews.author: L. Voluntaryist Chigi

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This sound bar is worth the money! It sounds AMAZING and we didn't have to mess with all the wires and speakers. We bought it for the living room but my husband liked it so much he bought another one for his man cave. We've got so many compliments on the sound that three of our relatives bought them for their homes.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Lots of sound from a small package
customer_reviews.text: This baby is a beast. It has a big bass sound, especially when loaded in the corners, but also reproduce some good mids and highs. I wish it could also use rechargeable batteries. Nevertheless, I love this puppy. I know it's discontinued. I hope the new one improves on this one and not fall backward.
customer_reviews.author: Methodical

customer_reviews.title: Sony soundbar
customer_reviews.text: The Sony HT-CT150 works just as I thought it would. No it's not a high powered unit like my 7.1 system , but a big improvement over the flat panel tv with downshot speakers. You need to be aware of the sub with a cord & 10' length , the wired sub was not an issue for my setup. Overall I'm happy with the sound of the soundbar. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: duke

customer_reviews.title: Good, affordable, and simple
customer_reviews.text: I thought the sound quality compared to my Toshiba Regza TV speakers was much better, although I can't say that I feel like I'm getting much "surround sound" effect from the sound bar. In the product's defense, my living room is shaped somewhat strangely, probably limiting the way that sound can project to the sides. Overall, this was a good choice for me to improve sound quality without having to hire an entire construction crew to figure out a way to integrate traditional surround sound into my living room. I think that option would have been a disaster due to the configuration of our space, and this was SO much simpler.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Robbins

customer_reviews.title: Pretty happy
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my small family room downstairs. I wanted some decent sound that didnt break the bank and wouldnt annoy everyone. The soundbar works awesome. It gets plenty loud, sounds pretty good too. Have used with a blu-ray and a xbox 360 and the sound is great for both. Cant say much about the virtual surround, I havent listned specifically for it. I dont feel as if I am missing out on anything sound wise so I either arent noticing the lack of surround sound or its there and Im just used to hearing it lol.
customer_reviews.author: Santiago Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Great sound bar system
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Love all the inputs it has available in the back of the subwoofer unit. Love being able to hear music in the shows we watch without hearing the TV speakers max out and get fuzzy. Cons: Don't like having an extra remote to have to turn on, but I haven't really experimented with trying to control both TV and sound from one yet.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: The sound bar performs just as expected. It's a great improvement on the TV (Sony) speakers. Certainly not a true surround sound nor audiophile quality. It's fine for what it is - a convenient, easily installed, inexpensive, small speaker system. Sound quality is ok, especially after doing simple adjustments. Reaches a good volume. Like that it works with regular remote and don't have to do any additional steps to use the soundbar. So, meets my expectations and is pretty much just what we needed.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: what I expected, but a little confusing to set up
customer_reviews.text: We were excited with the idea of only 2 pieces to create a surround sound and the sound is great. However, setting it up according to the booklet was confusing (at least for us). Also, as soon as we turn on the DVD player, the sound defaults to it. Then, after the movie, we must turn everything off and on again for the sound to go back to the TV. A bit frustrating, but we do like the sleek design and the sound options. We would recommend the system.
customer_reviews.author: C. Mullins

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the right price
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my mom for Christmas she loves this thing so much I honestly like this old model then I do the newest ones idk why but you do need to buy a small Bluetooth adapter if you want it like that, the sound is amazing has deep bass and I love it too.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Soto

customer_reviews.title: Weak Component Interface
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is an improvement over HDTV speakers, but not enough to justify the price. The remote control doesn't always interface with other controllers and becomes an additional controller to the pile on the coffee table. I now use it in conjunction with a Logitech Harmony One all-in-one controller and they seem to have personality conflicts.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Estes

customer_reviews.title: Subwoofer is the size of a desktop computer
customer_reviews.text: I bought the sound bar for my Sony TV. The sound quality is good when watching movies with explosions or movies with lots of bass.Like other reviewers pointed out the surround sound is not great, if you want a true surround sound get a multi speaker system. I was surprised by the size of the subwoofer its the size of a desktop computer.
customer_reviews.author: M. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: NO REGRETS WITH THIS GREAT SOUND SYSTEM!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, excellent service! This system was very easy to hook up to my entertainment system and the sound system bar fits nicely in front of the television on the cabinet; the sound quality is excellent. Product was packed very secure and arrived one day ahead of scheduled arrival.
customer_reviews.author: Tilley

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this particular model of the beatbox. I love it so much I'm considering buying another one for future use. My R&B, Hip hop, jazz anything with a little bass sounds great. I find it helpful to change the settings on my iPad/iPod to acoustic for a richer sound.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Junky

customer_reviews.title: Good system
customer_reviews.text: I was convinced to purchase this system, as I have a hard time hearing words and voices on television. I, of course, was willing to pretend old age isn't creeping up on me. After getting this, and having it customized to increase the voices and lower the other sounds, I find it so much easier to hear the words.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Hanna

customer_reviews.title: Very good for size
customer_reviews.text: I only have this in addition to the sound the TV puts out and it is very good for a small den area. Especially if you are sitting directly in front of it. I didn't want too much since the space is small (11x13) but wanted more than what the TV provided. Looks clean too. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: Not very 3 Dimensional
customer_reviews.text: ... But it sounds decent for the price. I opted for this over a 5.1 or 7.1 setup for my projector because of its space saving features. and convenience of setup. I was disappointed to find out there was no on-screen menu considering the complexity of the remote but what is nifty is the LCD display on the sub. The sound is great but 3D is a marketing buzz word these days and this falls very short of any kind of immersion. It's 2.1 with a stick connecting the front speakers. To make a long story short, this is going in the bedroom once I move into a house.with a living room big enough for 5.-7.1.
customer_reviews.author: Jason M.

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for the price
customer_reviews.text: This has a lot of connection options, and sounds great. The biggest complaint I have is the remote, It is not programmable so it is in addition to the TV and Roku remotes I have currently. This is disappointing as even my old Sony streamer remote was programmable to turn on the TV
customer_reviews.author: c

product_meta.title: Alphasonik Decor Modern Home Portable Bluetooth Speaker 360 Surround HD Sound with 10 Speakers Drivers Built-in Qi Wireless Charger Dual USB AUX Inputs End Table Coffee Table Night Stand Piano Black
product_meta.description:
Style:BLACKModernize your living room, patio, or bedroom with this Alphasonik wireless Bluetooth speaker Decor table with built-in wireless Qi charging station which features a contemporary design and durable construction. With a wireless Qi charger built in to the tabletop surface, you can charge your phone battery by simply placing it on the table - no cords needed! The Alphasonik Decor Bluetooth speaker charging table has multiple finish options that blend well with any color decoration. The table comes equipped with 2 USB ports, an AUX input, and a DC 16V power cord to charge the table itself so it can be moved to any location with no worries of having to plug it in like most charging devices. The Alphasonik Decor is ideal for indoor or outdoor, formal or informal settings. Enjoy the luxury of charging your phone wirelessly as well as 2 additional devices with a cord all while enjoying the meticulous design of the Bluetooth speaker embedded in the table! One port is a standard 5V 1A while the other is a fast charging enabled 5V 2.1A port. And for non-Bluetooth devices, this smart table has a 3.5mm AUX port which can play songs from any device. Other than wireless charging and Bluetooth, this table also comes with other features such as Auto Shut Off and Bluetooth wireless calling! The Decor is very easy to put together since all you have to do is screw on the 3 legs. The simple and elegant design offers unbelievable sound with 10 built in large audio drivers that offer full high definition stereo sound and provides enhanced bass! The 6,600mAh Li-ion batteries along with leading power technology combine to provide you with 24 hours of non-stop music! This one of a kind, sleek, elegant, yet technologically advanced piece of furniture will become your favorite without a doubt. Here at Alphasonik we strive to be a step ahead and this is our personal invitation for you to have the next best product in your household.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Sony
feature_bullets: SLEEK ELEGANT & FUNCTIONAL - Alphasonik Introduces the modern accent table. Standing 25 inches tall, this contemporary accent piece compliments any modern setting perfectly. Featuring sleek piano black finish wrapped in black fabric. This table features a powerful built-in Bluetooth speaker and wireless Qi charging for enabled smart devices. The table itself has a large rechargeable battery so you can move it around for wireless use.

360° BLUETOOTH SPEAKER - 10 state of the art drivers! 4 speakers, 2 tweeters and 4 passive radiators (bass) are wrapped behind the fabric producing crystal clear audio. This table produces a 360° full stereo effect producing massive audio to fill any sized room.

Qi WIRELESS CHARGING - The future is wireless. A built in wireless charger allows you to simply set your smart device on top of the Qi symbol on the center of the tabletop and it will begin charging your smart device. Compatible with all wirelessly enabled devices like iPhone, Samsung and more. Please note that Wireless charging only works when your phone is not covered with a protective case.

ALL THE PORTS - Two USB ports and AUX port are conveniently placed on the back side without sacrificing design. You can use the ports to power devices that require a cable or play music from any device using the included AUX cable.
QUICK & EASY INSTALLATION - Only 3 piece set up required and you're ready to enjoy within minutes!

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,101 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
